title: Jose Mourinho spells out what Manchester United record-setter Wayne Rooney must do to stay at Old Trafford
text:
Watch Next Read More ANDY DUNN: Rooney's not ready to reflect on his records - he's still hungry for more success 
“It’s always a pity when these guys, they come to the end, but we cannot stop the clock and they get older. 
"But when they take good care of themselves, when the wives help, when they train well, when the manager and the staff is intelligent enough to ­understand the difference between the body of a ­teenager or the body of a man of 30-something – when there is a combination of factors, they can delay the end of their career. 
“That’s why we have Michael Carrick, Zlatan [who are both 35] and Wayne performing.” 
Rooney would surely have equalled Charlton’s record sooner had he not been so selfless, willingly playing in a variety of positions to help the United cause. Rooney began his United career with a debut hat-trick vs Fenerbahce 12 years ago (Photo: Manchester United via Getty) Read More 
Under Sir Alex Ferguson he was shunted all over the pitch. 
He also occupied a deeper-lying midfield role under ­Mourinho’s ­predecessor, Louis van Gaal. 
Mourinho acknowledged Rooney’s inherent team-player ethic when he said: “I saw him always sacrificing for the team. 
“He played against me when I was in Madrid. He played almost left-back. I always saw him sacrifice for the team and with me he is the same. 
“He’s on the bench, he comes in. He plays, he doesn’t play, but he’s always positive with the group, a good captain, so I’m really happy. He is what I always felt — a humble guy, a good guy, professional, a team guy.” United are confident of reuniting forward Griezmann with France team-mate Paul Pogba (Photo: AFP/Getty) Read More Wayne Rooney's record — How much do you remember about his 249 United goals? 
United made light work of Reading, managed by their former defender Jaap Stam. 
Rooney opened the scoring, Anthony Martial added a second and a second-half double from Marcus Rashford sealed the emphatic win. 
But the day belonged to Rooney, a player who divides opinion and who has had to deal with criticism throughout his career – yet one whose achievements ensure he will be remembered as one of the all-time greats. Like us on Facebook
